bio:
Amar Nagaram is the Vice President of Engineering at Flipkart. In his current role, he is heading the Customer Shopping Experience Engineering, Catalog Engineering and FinTech wing, developing products that redefine the shopping experience online and making online shopping affordable . He is passionate about building Mobile and Progressive Web products from the ground-up to deliver superior value and user experience to the end consumer. He is equally passionate about building great teams. He believes in a design language that prefers "People over Pixels". He is excited about start-ups that are solving challenging problems for emerging markets and he works with many such start-ups, mentoring them on all things Mobile. He is also an advisor to half a dozen startups. 

Prior to Flipkart, he worked at @WalmartLabs - he was involved in strategy development for Walmartâs next generation e-commerce Platform. He was also instrumental in setting up @walmartlabs India center of excellence.

sessions.name: Getting the Progressive Web Apps Edge
sessions.description:
• Improving performance and removing baggage
  • Building with 2G networks in mind
  • App like UX built on the web
  • Challenges of being ahead of the curve
  • Embedding in your current architecture - Angular, Ember, React or plain JS.
  • What networks do and do not do
  • What about Native Apps

sessions.description:

  • Microservices

bio:
As highly regulated industries like financial services, healthcare and energy are revolutionised by technology, tight coordination between legal, product and design is critical. Briana and her colleague Izac Ross are looking forward to coming to Dublin and sharing how Collective Health created a collaborative process that allowed us to effect massive change in the US health insurance system.


Briana is a regulatory compliance expert focusing on helping designers and product managers create beautiful, meaningful, and innovative products that comply with highly nuanced areas of law. She brings a diverse approach to her legal practice by integrating legal interpretation with practical process development. Sheâs passionate about improving the way the US pays for healthcare, and her mission is to leave no stone unturned in search of the solution that provides the best consumer experience and health outcome.


Prior to joining Collective Health, Briana developed policy and drafted regulations pursuant to the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (âObamacareâ). She conducted analysis of actuarial value to calculate government subsidies available to individuals and families who buy health insurance. She launched a registration and training program for agents and brokers nationwide, and a program integrity strategy for the Health Insurance Exchanges on the Healthcare.gov platform. 


Prior to her legal career, Briana reviewed tax returns for the US Treasury and taught English in Mexico. When Briana is not noodling on complex legal questions at Collective Health, you can find her crafting, enjoying nature, or doing volunteer tax preparation for low-income families.

sessions.name: An Unlikely Friendship in Legal and Design
sessions.description:
• Business benefits of incorporating legal into design team from the beginning
  • User testing - having a better understanding on what route to take based on variables
  • Reducing risk of fraud and waste
  • Improving app flow: Allowing users to contribute more data to provide a more accurate long-term experience
  • Integrating legal interpretation with common sense: Success to date
sessions.questions: What is the future of the company?

bio: Brittni is a product strategist and awareness lead at AJ&Smart. With a background balanced in video advertising and tech, AJ&Smartâs efficient and process-driven approach to product design suits her really well. Oh, and she also does stand-up comedy sometimes.

Bryan is the CTO at Skyscanner, responsible for enabling a 400-strong global team of software engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers to earn the trust of hundreds of millions of travelers around the world by delivering a simple, elegant product experience.

Bryan has previously held leadership roles at Amazon Web Services, Skype, and Microsoft.

sessions.name: Empowering Autonomous Teams from the Top Down
sessions.description:
• Changing your organisation to understand and adopt modern software engineering practices
  • What successful execution of Agile and DevOps cultures looks like
  • Enabling designers, engineers and product managers to collaborate in product delivery
  • Designing a self managed organisation: Enabling leaders to support the culture-shift and the team to do their job
  • Continuous delivery, machine learning and experimentation at Skyscanner

job_title: Director of Digital Design, Data & Services

sessions.name: Using Psychology Processes for Better Team Collaboration
sessions.description:
• Analysing conflicts between Agile and UX: Speed of delivery vs Agile
  • Adapting Agile and Sprints to suit your own team
  • Understanding barriers and opportunities of working within a large organisation
  • The psychology of dealing with different business divisions and UX maturity levels
  • HIPPO: Proving the value in team collaboration through proof points
  • Moving beyond just centralised/decentralised teams

sessions.name: Digital Transformation Within Large Complex Cultures
sessions.description:
• How Digital Transformation has taken place within each company
  • Complexities and realities of introducing design thinking into larger organisations
  • Benefits and advantages of more focus on design thinking and UX methods
  • Trickling design thinking culture within the organisation

sessions.description:

  • Selling purpose to users

bio: Clive is a co founder and CTO of Plynk, the money messenger. He is a technology specialist with over 13 years experience in software development across online poker, re-insurance and digital finance. When he's not building Europe's first money messenger he has been known to play a hand or 2 of poker and dabble with improv comedy

sessions.description:

  • The offerings are huge - what do teams really need to get started?
  • Security considerations of a cloud system
  • Simple governance structures for companies to enable developers but manage security / costs

bio: Daniel Rolls is a senior developer at Sky where he is responsible for building web services for over the top delivery of video streams. Prior to joining Sky Daniel did a PhD in Computer Science and worked for various organisations including Xerox and The University of Hertfordshire. Daniel questioned the accuracy and interpretation of various metric dashboards and started investigating.

sessions.name: Improving Quality of Response Times: Application Performance Measurement
sessions.description:
• Collecting application performance metrics at Sky
  • Understanding how your service is performing to speed up production
  • Using histogram metrics to monitor response times
  • Good and bad practices when monitoring response times

bio: Donal O Mahony is Head of UX and Product Design in Fleetmatics, a Verizon Company. where he leads a team of researchers, content specialists, user experience designers and UI designers. He is responsible for all aspects of user research, product design and user experience and has grown the UX team from a standing start to 30 people within 1 year. Prior to joining Fleetmatics he was Director of UX and Design at HMHâs Dublin R&D office, where he led a team of 30 UX and UI designers. He is also a public speaker in the areas of UX and Design and has lectured in Trinity College Dublin and IADT. In a previous life, he was a musician and producer.

sessions.name: The Highs and Lows of Building a 30-person Lean UX Team in 1 Year
sessions.description:
• Institutionalising experience design & accelerating the UX maturity model
  • Hiring strategy - a phased approach to hiring (and no bean bags)
  • Scaling up versus staying Agile: Running âsquadsâ like lean start-ups
  • Outcomes â deliver on the promise of UX inch by inch in this new Verizon world
  • Roadmaps, Lean and Kanban boards â cycle time, KPIs, Heart, ROI & metrics for UX
  • The golden ratio â how many experience designers does it take to change a company?

sessions.name: Digital Transformation Within Large Complex Cultures
sessions.description:

bio:
Izac specialises in weaving together methods from interaction design, service management, business strategy and design research to solve problems that go beyond a single device, channel or medium. His mission: create the best possible experience for members of Collective Health.

Izac has a passion for working on complex problems in regulated industries. Prior to joining Collective Health, Izac held positions at Cooper, Moment Design and Philips Design. He has worked for a range of clients in healthcare, financial, and technology verticals including Philips Healthcare, Studio Dental, Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, Google, American Express, Morgan Stanley and Bloomberg.

Izac received a BFA in Service Design from Savannah College of Art and Design. When Izac is not designing Collective Healthâs member experience you will find him improvising in the kitchen, hunting for new music and biking around the city.

sessions.name: An Unlikely Friendship in Legal and Design

• Business benefits of incorporating legal into design team from the beginning
  • User testing - having a better understanding on what route to take based on variables
  • Reducing risk of fraud and waste
  • Improving app flow: Allowing users to contribute more data to provide a more accurate long-term experience
  • Integrating legal interpretation with common sense: Success to date
sessions.questions: What is the future of the company?

bio: John Moriarty is an interaction design lead with Fjord Dublin, part of Accentureâs new research and incubation hub. He leads multi-disciplinary design teams working on R&D projects, bringing user centred design and prototyping methods to emerging technology solutions. Prior to joining Fjord, he worked with HMH, building next generation digital education platforms and before that he set up and ran Design Partners' San Francisco product design studio. With a diverse background that spans physical and digital domains, he brings a holistic approach to design thinking and problem solving.

Jonathan Courtney is the co-founder of AJ&Smart, a multi-award winning digital product design agency based in Berlin. He writes a lot, and sometimes causes an industry fire with articles like this. But he also uses his writing for good and helps companies solve difficult design problems with new processes and snappy educational videos.

Jonathan has worked on products for companies like the United Nations, Lufthansa, Udacity, eBay, Zalando, Western Digital, UEFA, Red Bull and many more.


He also runs monthly product design events where he brings the best designers in the world in front of a live audience to nerd out. Heâs interviewed design leaders from companies like Google, IDEO, Lego, GV, Fjord and many more.

sessions.name: The Golden Age of UX: Why it Won't Last

bio:
Krzysztof Jackowski is a passionate developer and overall a very active guy. His technology of choice is Android. Krzysztof has been a specialising in this field for almost 5 years. It all started with an engineering project about Augmented Reality. Krzysztof is also an enthusiast of marketing and IT leadership.

Among many interests and hobbies, he loves travelling and meeting people with different backgrounds. He can always learn something new and exciting from them.

sessions.name: Moving 65,000 Microsofties to DevOps
sessions.description:
• Microsoftâs internal engineering systems: the pre DevOps days
  • Changing the company culture from the top and bottom up
  • The implementation approach
  • Unique challenges from Microsoft's structure
  • Lessons learned

bio: Mathias Buus is a self taught Javascript hacker from Copenhagen. He works full time on open source projects and have been working with Node.js since the 0.2 days. Mathias likes to work with P2P and distributed systems and is the author of more than 550 modules on npm, including some of the most popular ones for working with streams. In addition he has spoken about mad science projects at various conferences around the world.

  • The challenges in delivery - and the solution: standardJS
  • P2P for security and profit: what new models do P2P enable

bio: Michael is Co-Founder and CEO of Interplay.io, an innovative new platform which provides the fastest path possible from idea to tested user experience. We do this by integrating with existing design and development tools to enable the creation of fully functional, data-driven prototypes using you own Design System components. Prior to starting Interplay, Michael ran a successful design and development consultancy in Sydney, Australia for over 14 years, providing services to some of the worldâs largest corporations such as Rio Tinto, ExxonMobil and Cadbury Schweppes.

As the Lead Principal Software Engineer in ASOS Technology, Nik Crabtree is responsible for Software and QA Engineering, UI Engineering and Data Engineering across the organisation. His role has a simple brief: come in every day with one aim â make engineering and engineers at ASOS better. Nik joined ASOS in March 2015 after six years at Avanade where he lead the Cloud & Integration Practice. Nik worked on both Azure and on-premises solutions with customers such as Skype, Blinkbox, Barclays, Best Buy and ASOS.

sessions.description:

  • Collaborating with teams in QA and development
  • Helping customers understand and communicate what they want
  • Testing and scaling to improve development

bio: Noelle LaCharite is an evangelist. She is passionate about voice technology, AI bots and Mindful Leadership. As a Sr. Technical Program Manager at Amazon Alexa, she owns and manages projects that will help define the vision for Alexaâs voice experience, drive investments in accuracy and end-to-end voice experience quality and find opportunities for increasing innovation across the data science and engineering teams related to machine learning. She has spent many years as a technical trainer and evangelist for IBM, a Solution Architect for RedHat and in Education Leadership at Amazon Web Services. She has been an enterprise developer, architect and principle consultant over a decade. She has been voted a top 10 presenter at RedHat Summit and has spoken at dozens of technical and digital marketing events. As an Evangelist for voice technologies, she develops demonstrations, white papers and tutorials and speaks at technical conferences, seminars and executive meetings.

sessions.name: Designing Voice Driven Experiences
sessions.description:
Alexa, the voice service that powers Amazon Echo, Echo Dot, Amazon Tap and Amazon Fire TV provides a set of built-in abilities that enable customers to interact with devices in a more intuitive way using voice. Examples of these skills include the ability to play music, answer general questions, set an alarm or timer and more.

  • Diving into Amazonâs machine learning model *Making AI and machine learning more accessible to all developers, product managers and designers
  • Proven best practices for designing voice user interfaces (VUI)
  • How to maximise usability of your voice experience
  • How to create compelling voice experiences
  • Building voice activated products - where products will turn to in the future

sessions.description:

  • Complexities and realities of introducing design thinking into larger organisations
  • Benefits and advantages of more focus on design thinking and UX methods
  • Trickling design thinking culture within the organisation

bio: Pawel Kontek is a self-taught Product Designer with 3 years of experience. Working at Netguru, he has cooperated with start-ups and mature companies from industries like social care, education, networking and tourism. Recently, Pawel has focused on creating an app which uses psychological tests to help you plan your career path. His cooperation with developers is directed at working out processes which ensure the successful implementation of designers' work.

Richard Rodger is a co-founder of nearForm.com. Richard is an expert and thought-leader in next-generation enterprise software delivery, with a focus on Node.js and microservices. He is currently writing The Tao of Microservices (available on early release from manning.com/books/the-tao-of-microservices), a comprehensive guide to designing and building microservice systems. His first book Mobile Application Development in the Cloud (Wiley, 2010) is one of the first major works on the intersection of Node.js, Cloud, and Mobile.


Richard was previously CTO of FeedHenry, a mobile application platform provider that was acquired by RedHat for â¬63.5m in 2014. Since Richard co-founded nearForm in 2011, the company has become the worldâs largest Node.js and microservices consulting company. Richard has long been an active member and influencer of the open source software (OSS) community, specializing in OSS for enterprise. At nearForm, he has placed OSS at the hear of how the company works. He is the maintainer of senecajs.org, a microservices framework for Node.js that is a key component of nearFormâs software development and delivery capability. Richard is the host of the Dublin Microservices Meetup.

sessions.name: Designing Microservice Architectures
sessions.description:

  • What are the patterns that you use to build message flows between services?
  • What are the ways that those messages flows will fail? Solving scalability
  • How do you distribute complexity evenly?
  • Discovery & other challenges

bio:
Rob Campion is a Tech Lead at HubSpot. Rob is passionate about web development and has worked in the industry for almost 10 years. He began his career at IBM, before moving to MasterCard, Spencer Stuart and finally HubSpot. Since joining HubSpot, heâs worked on Website Grader, Customer Success Tooling and currently leads their efforts to transform notifications and communications via in-app, mobile and email messaging.

Rob currently builds web apps using ReactJS. He founded and co-organizes the ReactJS Dublin Meetup, which has grown to over 1,000 members.

bio: Tony has worked in technology for +20 years and was most recently CEO of a global gaming company, Demonware (an Activision company), where he was responsible for amongst other things online communities numbering 10s of millions. Tony has worked for IBM amongst others and is an active angel investor in Ireland.
